channel.title: Comments on: The Magnetic Fields polarize critics with Distortion

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Thanks for the thoughtful comment, mike!

item.title: By: patrick
item.dc:creator: patrick
item.description:
mike:
you're trolling on an internet message board. get over <i>your</i>self, please.
item.content:encoded:
mike:

you’re trolling on an internet message board. get over yourself, please.

item.title: By: mike
item.dc:creator: mike
item.description: k, you are obnoxious. you leave me scratching my head in amazement at your pretentiousness with every post. distortion is a fine addition to the magnetic fields catalog. this is a rare band that can morph into any number of styles, yet their signature sound is always evident. it's just another magnetic fields album, a good time if you're willing to have one. get over yourself, please. and while i have your attention, hear me out: this moronic insistence that making a few dollars by letting your music play on a car commercial amounts to some heinous crime against the underground is so incredibly childish. if the books can afford to record another album instead of getting real jobs, i really don't care that they are taking money from hummer. in fact, it's fucking hilarious.
item.content:encoded:
k, you are obnoxious. you leave me scratching my head in amazement at your pretentiousness with every post. distortion is a fine addition to the magnetic fields catalog. this is a rare band that can morph into any number of styles, yet their signature sound is always evident. it’s just another magnetic fields album, a good time if you’re willing to have one. get over yourself, please.
and while i have your attention, hear me out:
this moronic insistence that making a few dollars by letting your music play on a car commercial amounts to some heinous crime against the underground is so incredibly childish. if the books can afford to record another album instead of getting real jobs, i really don’t care that they are taking money from hummer. in fact, it’s fucking hilarious.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Indeed. The fact that someone with a signed copy of an obscure Stephin Merritt 7" is willing to eat it to prove that Distortion is Bad Bad Bad, should be an indication of the level of fandom involved. Sigh.
item.content:encoded: Indeed. The fact that someone with a signed copy of an obscure Stephin Merritt 7″ is willing to eat it to prove that Distortion is Bad Bad Bad, should be an indication of the level of fandom involved. Sigh.

item.title: By: patrick
item.dc:creator: patrick
item.description: You obviously don't know these Drawer B gents very well, do you?
item.content:encoded: You obviously don’t know these Drawer B gents very well, do you?

item.title: By: jhn
item.dc:creator: jhn
item.description: "Distortion" is really good. I would bet that most critics who don't get it, are not very familiar with his catalog.
item.content:encoded: “Distortion” is really good. I would bet that most critics who don’t get it, are not very familiar with his catalog.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: If you honestly like it a month after listening, I'll eat my "I Don't Believe You" 7" liner notes with Stephin's post-show-completely-disinterested scrawling all over them.
item.content:encoded: If you honestly like it a month after listening, I’ll eat my “I Don’t Believe You” 7″ liner notes with Stephin’s post-show-completely-disinterested scrawling all over them.
